intro: Didiscus scapiger, commonly known as the scapigerous didiscus, is a rare and unusual member of the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its unique, flattened, disk-like leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in a distinctive, umbel-like arrangement. It is native to specific regions in South America, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments. Due to its rarity and unique morphology, it is of particular interest to botanists and horticulturists.
